## Club Objectives

- Build a support community around Linux
- Promote open source software
- Extend the lifespan of computing device
- Teach about the philisophical aspects of the open source movement
- Secure our electronics from digital and physical threats

# Tentative Lecture Topics

## Introductory Topics

### Introduction to Linux

- What is Linux?
- The Linux and UNIX philosophy
    - "Do one thing and do it well"
- Setting up WSL on Windows / QEMU on Mac so people can play with Linux

### Distro Comparison

- Package managers across distros: `apt`, `dnf`, `pacman`, `nix`, etc.
- Installing and updating software
- Package managers revisit during scripting/devops topics
- What makes different distros different
- Why would you choose one over the other
- What are some applications of different distros
- Why arenâ€™t you already on nix

### Shell Scripting and Bash Essentials

- Command line basics and utilities
- Bash and its derivatives
- Environment variables, pipes, redirection
- Writing simple bash scripts
- Variables, conditionals, loops
- Automating tasks with scripts

### Filesystems and File Mangement

- Basic Linux filesystem structure (FHS)
- File permissions (`chmod`, `chown`)
- Mounting and navigating the filesystem
- Filesystems overview: ext4, XFS, Btrfs, ZFS
- Disk tools: `lsblk`, `fdisk`, `mount`, `df`
- FS structure comparison / deep dive
- Plan 9 brief rundown

### Networking, Web Servers, and Security

- Linux networking tools: `ip`, `ss`, `nmap`, etc.
- Web servers: Nginx, Apache
- Reverse proxies
- SELinux
- AppArmor
- Containerization
- Ethical Hacking Rundown

### Desktop Linux

- Overview of DEs: GNOME, KDE, XFCE, i3
- Customizing your Linux desktop
- X11 vs Wayland
- Desktop Portals
- DBus
- XDG

## Intermediate Topics

### Linux Tools and The Linux Boot Process

- GRUB and EFI
- Init systems: systemd
- Systemd Day (services, timers, `journalctl`, mounts, networkd)
- Vim basics and configuration
- Git basics (clone, commit, push)
- Crontab and job scheduling

### Virtualization, VMs, and Containers

- QEMU and KVM
- Playing around with VMs
- Wine/Proton for running Windows software
- Docker vs Podman
- OCI concepts
- Containerization Day:
    - Build and run containers
    - Compare with VMs
    - systemd-nspawn

### Cloud and Infrastructure

- Cloud Hosting Day:
    - AWS intro
    - How to use cloud VMs (e.g., EC2)
- Terraform, Pulumi, IaC basics

## Harder Topics

### DevOps Fundamentals

- CI/CD concepts
- Ansible overview
- Introduction to Kubernetes
- Nix overview (precursor to Nix day)

### Nix Day

- What is Nix?
- NixOS and reproducible builds
- Declarative configuration

### Kernel and LFS Deep Dive

- Kernel architecture: processes, memory, syscalls
- Modules and drivers
- Kernel parameters
- Simple kernel module programming
- Linux From Scratch (LFS) overview
    - Custom kernels
    - Building Linux manually
